review_blob: Nice grassy hop aroma. THICK cream head with a brownish body. Seems a little too carbonated. good hop flavor that matches the aroma. clean sweet finish with a little bitterness. Not a bad beer but not amazing by any means
beer_name: Bear Republic / Fat Heads / Stone TBA

review_blob: Bottle of Rasputin XII. Pours pretty dark but not as much as i would have thought. Very creamy tan head. Looks amazing. Sweet aroma with very strong notes of bourbon, licorice, and maybe some molasses. WOW...so many different flavors going on with such an incredible smooth mouthfeel. subtle bourbon, dark fruit, butterscotch notes and the finish is a little chocolatety. Incredible beer well worth aging.

Growler from CBX. Very dark body with a head that leaves very nice lacing. Amazing floral aroma. very resinous mouthfeel that kinda dominates any roastiness you would expect. Nice typical bitter IPA finish where some of the roatiness presents itself. Very good beer

beer_brewer_name: Coney Island Brewing Company (Boston Beer Company)
review_blob: very deep amber body with a tan medium bodied head. very smooth Bourbon aroma with slight boozy notes and a bit of hops. very sweet smooth caramel flavor with nice vanilla notes. a little too carbonated in my opinion. nice malty finish, but short-lived. good beer
beer_name: Coney Island Human Blockhead - Barrel Aged

review_blob: stout like color with a thick tan head. very rich malty and piney aroma. Very resinous and grassy hop flavor with a nice malty backing to it. alcohol present on the finish with a nice lingering hop bitterness. Quite tasty.
beer_name: Stone 15th Anniversary Escondidian Imperial Black IPA

review_blob: Deep black pour with a thick, creamy tan head. strong boozy notes, with a heavy contribution from the barrel aging. incredibly sweet taste with some faint whiskey notes. the finish is a great transition from the sweet taste to a good roasty stout finish that coats the mouth with a smooth bitterness. an excellent beer, but a one time purchase based on the price.

pitch black pour with a finger and a half tan head. wonderful chocolate nose with a slight boozy note. very nice roasty, chocolate flavor. not much coffee flavor till the finish, where a malty bitterness lingers. not bad, but overpriced to buy again
beer_name: Ballast Point Sea Monster Imperial Stout

review_blob:
growler from Bills liquors in summerville
nice copper hue with a thick fluffy white head. nice citrus aroma. very light and easy to drink. mild hop flavor and bitterness. run of the mill IPA

very light pale body with a short lived white head. very strong and pleasant floral/piney aroma. very resinous mouthfeel with an excellent balance between the malt and hops, with the hops overpowering the malt a bit. excellent lingering floral bitter finish. real good beer.

clear orange/amber body with a medium density head. nice grapefruit aroma, but nothing amazing. mild bitterness with an oily mouth feel. finish was a nice bitterness, but nothing amazing. decent beer but way overpriced

clean reddish orange pour with a white mildly fizzy head. terrific piney/floral aroma with a slight citrus note. Very light, crisp malty body with a clean floral hop flavor. an amazing malt finish with a medium amount of bitterness. very tasty beer

very dark black pour with a nice medium density mocha colored head. Very nice boozy notes balanced very well with a roasty, chocolate aroma. Very creamy mouthfeel with a sweet maltiness. Finish is a nice mild roasty bitterness that lingers for quite awhile. very good beer
beer_name: Terrapin Side Project Big Daddy Vladys Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: one of the darkest pours ive ever seen with a thin fizzy dark brown head  that disappears fast. definitely picking up some dark fruit and barrel aromas. such a smooth taste from a bottle thats prolly about 2 years old. little bit of tingle on the lips from the high ABV. delicious dark roasty flavor with some noticeable dark fruit taste to it. Finish is amazingly smooth, with some more of that dark fruity taste lingering around. this beer ages to perfection.

Typical beautiful RIS appearance. Smooth, sweet chocolate aroma with a bit of the booze popping out too. the hop character seems to be a love/hate matter of opinion with most, and i love it. its really well balanced with the tasty roasted malts. the chocolate flavor is fantastic and it is one of the smoothest going down that i have had in a while. nice sweet finish...im gonna need to get more of these for the winter
beer_name: Smuttynose Big Beer Series: Imperial Stout

review_blob: very dark brown with a dense creamy tan head. Pretty intense roasty aroma with a bit of spiciness from the alcohol. very smooth not overpowering coffee taste. alcohol is very well hidden. very clean chocolaty finish. really good beer. definitely one to have again
beer_name: Sweetwater Dank Tank Mean Joe Bean

review_blob: bottle from may 2010. opaque black body and a thick mocha head. roasty, dark chocolate aroma and a bit of spiciness from the booze. amazing taste of dark chocolate with a slight spiciness from the booze. Finish is an amazing combo of bitterness and slight spice or pepper as advertised. the pepper just lingers in a not overwhelming way. i love this beer
beer_name: Great Divide Yeti Imperial Stout - Chocolate Oak Aged

review_blob: 2009 bottle. very nice copper red body with a small white head. very nice subtle fruit aroma and a very slight booziness to it. the oak stands out a bit with a nice fruitiness in the taste. very smooth. nice lingering, dark fruit finish. i believe this definitely improved with aging

opaque black pour with a quickly dissipating head. Boozy, roasty aroma and a slight spiciness representing the Belgian aspect. spice from the booze and notes of dark chocolate. Fizziness is a little over powering. finish is a huge amount of roasty bitterness that lingers forever. a huge warming feeling is felt in the stomach within minutes. this is a really good beer, but could definitely benefit from a year or so in the cellar

Light hazy orange body with a little white head. huge citrus hop aroma to start, but as it sits for a bit, a belgian spiciness becomes more prevalent. nice hop flavor, giving way to an excellent balance of hop bitterness and a belgian spice. one of the better belgian style IPAs that ive had
beer_name: Hoppin Frog Hop Masters Abbey Belgian-Style Double IPA

review_blob: deep amber/brown body with a fizzy white head. Head dissapears insanely quick. nice mild fruity aroma. the taste of banana really stands out. very clean finish. not really familiar with this style, but i did enjoy this one
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Dunkelweiss

review_blob: hazy orange body and a nice fine white head. slight boozy aroma but is overshadowed by fruity hops. taste is nice and hoppy but i was expecting more. the mean malanishi seemed hoppier to me. finish is a great bitterness that just coats the mouth and lingers for minutes. really good beer
beer_name: Hoppin Frog Hop Dam Triple IPA

review_blob: hazy orange with a pillowy white head. citrus aroma slightly diminished by the booze notes, but still really nice. Really nice hop taste that ramps up quickly. Very resinous feel in the mouth, leaving a nice sticky bitter finish. pretty tasty, but i think i like the blended beers better by themselves

orange pour with a thin white head. Hop aroma is spectacular. big floral and citrus notes, maybe a little booze too. nice hop bite in the taste, maybe a little overshadowed by the booze. real nice bitterness on the finish. Tasty brew

Big cream colored head and a hazy dark orange body. Nice piney hop aroma. crazy long head retention. a little overcarbonated in my opinion. not really much to the flavor as far as hops are concerned. Good bitter finish though

hazy copper body with nice white head. Aroma is an amazing floral citrus blend with a slight hint of booze. Intense hop flavor, but balanced with a very sweet malt backbone. an amazing resinous bitterness lingers in the mouth for a substantial period of time. Delicious!
nice copper body and a big head. fantastic spicy, floral aroma. Sticky piney hop taste with slight citrus notes. not much of a finish, kind of thin. pretty refreshing beer to beat the heat

#33...nice golden color with a white lacey head. very floral aroma, like most fresh hop IPAs. very nice bitterness slightly overpowering the sweetness of the malt. very smooth finish. tasty first offering for me from this brewery
beer_name: Harpoon 100 Barrel Series #20 - Glacier Harvest Wet Hop Beer

review_blob: very light in appearance with an amazing tropical fruit aroma. i can definitely see the mango that they claim, and there is a subtle hop aroma with it as well. super fruity, clean taste with a nice crisp finish. perfect amount of tartness. this beer is terrific.
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Le Terroir

review_blob: Pitch black, as one would guess, with a nice tan head. Very sweet boozy aroma. fairly roasty with nice notes of dark chocolate that lingers for a while. Alcohol is a little more subdued but still quite prevalent. i think i might tuck one of these away for a year. very good stout though
deep ruby color without much head. Sweet boozy aroma. sweet maltiness prevails with some hints of scotch. a little overly carbonated i think. nice finish though. overall slightly dissapointing
beer_name: Green Flash / Pizza Port / Stone Highway 78 Scotch Ale

review_blob: DEEP amber red, nearly brown, body with a thick tan head that leave a nice lacing. The aroma is delicious, with notes of cinnamon, and hot apple cider. The alcohol is completely hidden, with a fairly sweet malt backbone. kind of a letdown from the aroma though.nice slightly bitter finish. very tasty.

2009 bottle. Dense creamy tan head and a pitch black pour. terrific boozy/dark fruity aroma. smooth roasty taste with a nice lingering bitterness on the back of the tongue. ABV is not even close to noticeable. i wish i had more of these

on draft at a local growler fill station. Lady said it was a triple IPA, which sold me. (obviously not) Clear golden color with little white head. looks like a cheap domestic lager. spicy floral hop aroma. more of a belgian than IPA as far as the taste goes. spicy belgian finish than turns into a mild lingering bitterness. kind of dissapointing

deep black pour with a beautiful tan head. laces quite nicely. Aroma is nice, with faint vanilla, roasty malts, and a bit of booze. taste is dominated by roasted malt, with a bit of coffee and alcohol thrown in there. decent bitter coffee finish. not bad, but i dont see what all the hype was about

Deep brown pour with a semi dense tan head. Aroma has a lot going on, with notes of coffee, vanilla and a nice spiciness from the booze. LOTS going on with this flavor; a nice herbal/dark fruit flavor with some definite alcohol spiciness. slight oakiness to it as well. sweet toffee finish as well as my mouth remains tingling from the ABV. cant wait to have another in a year or so
hazy orange body with a quickly vanishing white head. nice citrusy aroma. Pretty standard IPA. nice bitter finish though

nice black body with a dense tan head. smokey roasty malts and a hint of chocolate make this aroma seem more stout like than black IPA but is still nice. taste is a bit spicy form the booze, malty and bitter. im not really sure how it got the black IPA moniker but it is undeserved. this is stout with a stout taste and slightly spicy bitter finish. not bad but not what i expected
beer_name: Mad River Serious Madness Black Ale

review_blob: slightly cloudy tan pour with a nice, white, lacey head. aroma is slightly spicy but full of citrus hops and a bit of booze. the taste is phenomenal. very boozy but countered quite well with the hops used. the finish is hoppy with a hint of booze and incredibly clean. one of my favorites.
beer_name: Avery The Maharaja Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob: Very nice reddish amber body with a lingering off white head. Great boozy,  citrus hop notes. taste is almost identical to the aroma, except the booze is well hidden. great, slightly bitter finish. one of the best imperial IPAs ive had in a long time.

very light in appearance with a fluffy white head. laces great down the side. Smell is quite a resinous hoppy smell that i find amazing. taste is good, but it didnt quite back up the initial aroma. clean crisp finish. very easy to drink

pours like a typical hef; cloudy orange with mid density white head. Faint citrus aroma that i find to be a bit lacking if you are gonna say its an IPA. the taste does not falter, however, delivering a massive resinous hop punch while still maintaining the wheat beer feel in the mouth. great long lasting, bitter hop finish. quite refreshing.
beer_name: Midnight Sun Hop Dog Double Wheat IPA

review_blob: Clear light amber pour with a thin white head. strong aroma of belgian yeast. very nice hop taste with a well balanced belgian/IPA finish. alcohol is pretty well hidden. nice beer for the dog days of summer.

very light body and medium density white head. sprucey aroma, very herbal in nature with a little spice. the juniper is a bit overwhelming in the taste. good malts in it, afraid its just not my style.

Reddish brown pour with a loud, fizzy head. Strange looking for a belgian strong ale. Typical spicy Belgian aroma. clean sweet taste. Picking up a bit of the orange bitters mentioned on the label. i think i expected too much from this, solely based on the amazing label.
beer_name: Caldera Kettle Series Vas Deferens Ale

review_blob: pitch black with dark tan head. strong bourbon and alcohol notes in the aroma. strong bourbon flavor and very smooth for the abv. nice vanilla finish with a oaky hint. amazing beer.

dark thin looking body with a thin beige head. nice roasty aroma with a little hop influence. Good resiney hop taste and malt backing, but the finish is thin and watery, tasting like nearly nothing at all. i was really expecting more.
Very dark pour with a THICK chocolatety head that lasts forever. Lacking a bit in the aroma department. Initial chocolate flavor with a sweet roasty finish. not bad

creamy tan head on top of a very dark pour. Aroma seems like a very nice balance of hops and malt and it does not lie. The hops are not as present in the initial taste as i would like, but leaves a very nice bitter finish. tasty beer.
Very fizzy white head diminishing to nothing very quickly. Clear pale body. Aroma is fruity with a slight woody note. Incredibly tart with a nice fruit finish. good beer for a hot day
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Erics Ale

review_blob: Slightly cloudy orange body with a dense long lasting white head. Aroma is a nice citrusy hop punch to the face. terrific hop taste with a slightly bitter resiny finish. Very good IPA
beer_name: Lost Coast Indica India Pale Ale
